name: Azerbaijan
description: Azerbaijan, a land of ancient history and stunning natural beauty, is located at the crossroads of Europe and Asia.  It boasts a diverse landscape ranging from the towering Caucasus Mountains to the Caspian Sea, offering a unique blend of cultures and experiences.  Rich in oil and gas reserves, Azerbaijan is also increasingly recognized for its burgeoning tourism sector and commitment to sustainable development.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is a fascinating mix of modern architecture and historic Old City.
quickFacts.detail: Baku is the second-largest city in the Caucasus region and a major economic and cultural center.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Azerbaijan has a diverse population with significant ethnic groups including Azeris, Lezgins, Talishes, and Russians.
quickFacts.detail: The Azeri language is the official language, but Russian and English are also widely spoken.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Azerbaijan's territory includes a significant portion of the Caspian Sea coastline.
quickFacts.detail: The country is strategically located, connecting Europe and Asia.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Manat is pegged to the US dollar.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Turkish and Russian are also commonly spoken.

climateData.title: Climate of Azerbaijan
climateData.description: Azerbaijan experiences a diverse climate due to its varied topography. The coastal regions enjoy a humid subtropical climate, while the mountainous areas have a continental climate. The northern regions experience a subarctic climate, particularly in winter.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with wildflowers blooming across the countryside and the return of migratory birds.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are hot and dry, especially in the lowlands. The Caspian Sea offers a refreshing escape with its cool breezes.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn is characterized by pleasant temperatures and colorful foliage in the mountains. Rainfall increases, and the landscape transforms into a stunning tapestry of reds and golds.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are cold and snowy, particularly in the northern and mountainous regions. Baku experiences milder winters due to the influence of the Caspian Sea.

naturalWonders.name: Shahdag Mountain
naturalWonders.description: Shahdag is a majestic mountain range in the foothills of the Greater Caucasus, offering breathtaking views and excellent skiing opportunities. It's a relatively young mountain range, formed by recent tectonic activity.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is known for its dramatic peaks, glaciers, and pristine forests. The area is also home to diverse wildlife, including brown bears and lynx.
viewingTips: Bring warm clothing and sturdy footwear.
Check weather conditions before heading out.

naturalWonders.name: Mud Volcanoes of Azerbaijan
naturalWonders.description: Azerbaijan is home to the largest concentration of mud volcanoes in the world, a truly unique and surreal landscape. These volcanoes are formed by the buildup of hydrocarbon-rich mud and gas beneath the surface.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mud volcanoes range in size from small vents to massive structures. The bubbling mud creates a distinctive smell and a mesmerizing spectacle.
viewingTips: Wear protective clothing to avoid mud splashes.
Be aware of the potential for unstable ground.

naturalWonders.name: Caspian Sea Coast
naturalWonders.description: The Caspian Sea coastline offers a diverse range of landscapes, from sandy beaches to rocky cliffs, and is home to unique flora and fauna.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The sea is rich in oil and gas reserves, and the coastal areas are important for fishing and tourism. The mudflats are a vital habitat for migratory birds.
viewingTips: Check tide times before visiting the beaches.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Azerbaijan
ecosystemData.overview: Azerbaijan’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, reflecting its varied geography and climate. From the high-altitude forests of the Caucasus to the wetlands of the Caspian Sea, the country supports a rich array of plant and animal life.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of the country's territory is protected.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Azerbaijan’s forests cover approximately 2.5% of the country’s land area, primarily in the northern and eastern regions.

statistics.details: Includes various deciduous and coniferous species.

notableSpecies.name: Caucasian Fir
notableSpecies.significance: An iconic tree species of the Caucasus Mountains.

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: The Caspian Sea wetlands and numerous lakes and rivers provide vital habitats for a wide range of bird species and other wildlife.

statistics.details: Important stopover site for migratory birds.
Includes coastal lagoons and river deltas.

notableSpecies.name: Siberian Crane
notableSpecies.significance: A globally threatened species that breeds in Azerbaijan.

notableSpecies.name: White-tailed Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: A majestic raptor found in the wetlands.

biodiversityCategory.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategory.description: Azerbaijan is home to a variety of mammal species, including brown bears, wolves, lynx, and wild boars.

statistics.details: Includes both resident and migratory species.

statistics.count: Diverse, from mountains to forests to wetlands
statistics.details: Each species has specific habitat requirements.

notableSpecies.name: Brown Bear
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of the Caucasus Mountains.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Azerbaijan
activities.description: Azerbaijan offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from hiking and cycling to water sports and wildlife viewing.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the stunning landscapes of Azerbaijan on foot, from the Caucasus Mountains to the Caspian Sea coast.

activities.name: Shahdag Mountain Hike
activities.description: Hike through the forests and meadows of Shahdag Mountain, enjoying panoramic views.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water, sunscreen, hat.

activities.name: Gabala Forest Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail through the Gabala Forest, perfect for a leisurely hike.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports on the Caspian Sea and Azerbaijan’s lakes.

activities.name: Caspian Sea Sailing
activities.description: Sail across the Caspian Sea, experiencing the vastness of the region.

activities.name: Lake Zuga Water Skiing
activities.description: Enjoy water skiing and wakeboarding on the clear waters of Lake Zuga.

clothing.winter: Warm coat, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots.
clothing.yearRound: Comfortable walking shoes, layers of clothing.

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass.
